whatIsFreshtrack.question: What is FreshTrack?
whatIsFreshtrack.answer: FreshTrack is an inventory management system for hotels that helps track product expiration dates. The system alerts you about upcoming expirations, helps minimize waste, and maintains quality standards.

whatIsBatch.question: What is a batch?
whatIsBatch.answer: A batch is a specific delivery of a product with a particular expiration date and quantity. For example, you might have 3 batches of milk with different expiration dates. The system tracks each batch separately.

howToAddBatch.question: How do I add a new product batch?
howToAddBatch.answer:
1. Go to the "Inventory" page
2. Find the product and click on it
3. In the modal, click "Add Batch"
4. Enter the expiration date and quantity
5. Click "Save"

Tip: Use quick templates for frequently used products.

batchStatuses.question: What do the colored status indicators mean?
batchStatuses.answer:
• Green — product is in good condition (more than 7 days until expiry)
• Yellow — warning (4-7 days until expiry)
• Orange — critical status (1-3 days until expiry)
• Red — expired (past expiration date)

Thresholds can be customized in "Notification Rules".

filterInventory.question: How do I filter and sort inventory?
filterInventory.answer:
• Use categories at the top of the page to filter by product type
• Click the sort icon to choose order: by expiry date, name, or quantity
• Use global search (magnifying glass in header) to quickly find items across all inventory

whatIsFifo.question: What is FIFO and how does it work?
whatIsFifo.answer:
FIFO (First-In-First-Out) is a method where products with the earliest expiration date are used first. This helps minimize losses from expired products.

When you make a collection, the system automatically selects the oldest batches.

howToCollect.question: How do I collect/use a product?
howToCollect.answer:
1. Open a product card in inventory
2. Click the "FIFO Collection" button (lightning icon)
3. Enter the quantity to collect
4. Select a reason: used in kitchen, expired, damaged, etc.
5. Add a comment if needed
6. Confirm the collection

The system automatically collects from the oldest batches.

collectionReasons.question: What collection reasons are available?
collectionReasons.answer:
• Kitchen — used in food preparation
• Expired — past expiration date
• Damaged — product is spoiled or damaged
• Return — returned to supplier
• Compliment — given to guest
• Other — other reason (specify in comments)

notificationTypes.question: What notifications do I receive?
notificationTypes.answer:
The system sends notifications about:
• Expired products (require immediate attention)
• Critical — expiring in 1-3 days
• Warning — expiring in 4-7 days

Notifications appear on the dashboard, notifications page, and can be sent to Telegram.

telegramNotifications.question: How do I set up Telegram notifications?
telegramNotifications.answer:
1. Find @freshtracksystemsbot in Telegram
2. Add it to your department's group chat
3. Send the command /link MARSHA_CODE (e.g., /link NYCVZ)
4. The bot will confirm the link

Notifications will now be sent to this chat automatically.

calendarUsage.question: How do I use the calendar?
calendarUsage.answer:
The calendar shows a visual representation of expiration dates:

• Day color indicates the status of products expiring that day
• Click a day to see the product list
• Use arrows to navigate between months
• "Today" button returns to the current date

This helps plan purchases and product usage.

changePassword.question: How do I change my password?
changePassword.answer:
1. Click your name in the top right corner
2. Select "Settings"
3. In the "Profile" section, click "Change Password"
4. Enter current and new password
5. Confirm the change

Password must be at least 8 characters, including letters and numbers.

changeLanguage.question: How do I change the interface language?
changeLanguage.answer:
The system supports 8 languages: Russian, English, Kazakh, German, French, Spanish, Italian, and Arabic.

1. Open "Settings"
2. Go to the "Language" tab
3. Select your language

Changes apply immediately.

notificationRules.question: How do I configure notification rules?
notificationRules.answer:
1. Open "Settings" → "Notification Rules"
2. Set threshold values:
   • Critical threshold (default 3 days)
   • Warning threshold (default 7 days)
3. Save changes

These settings affect color indicators and notification timing.

viewCollectionHistory.question: How do I view collection history?
viewCollectionHistory.answer:
1. Go to "Collection History" in the sidebar menu
2. Use filters:
   • By department
   • By collection reason
   • By date
3. Export data to Excel or PDF if needed

useTemplates.question: How do I use quick add templates?
useTemplates.answer:
Templates speed up adding frequently used products:

1. Open "Settings" → "Templates"
2. Create a template with a set of products
3. When adding inventory, select "Quick Add"
4. Choose a template and enter expiration dates

This saves time for regular deliveries.

manageUsers.question: How do I manage users?
manageUsers.answer:
1. Open "Settings" → "Accounts"
2. Here you can:
   • View all hotel users
   • Activate/deactivate accounts
   • Filter by role and status
   • Export user list

To create a new user, go to "Users".

manageDepartments.question: How do I manage departments and categories?
manageDepartments.answer:
1. Open "Settings" → "Directories"
2. Manage:
   • Departments (Bar, Restaurant, Mini Bar, etc.)
   • Product categories (Alcohol, Beverages, Snacks, etc.)
   • Products (product types for inventory)

Each department is isolated — staff only see their own department.

viewAuditLogs.question: How do I view audit logs?
viewAuditLogs.answer:
1. Go to "Audit Logs" in the sidebar menu
2. The system records all actions:
   • User logins and logouts
   • Data creation and editing
   • Collections and write-offs
   • Settings changes
3. Filter by action type, user, date
4. Export for auditing

importExport.question: How do I import/export data?
importExport.answer:
Export:
1. "Settings" → "Import/Export"
2. Select format (Excel or PDF)
3. Set filters (department, category, period)
4. Click "Export"

Import:
1. Download the Excel template
2. Fill in data following the example
3. Upload the file to the system
4. Review preview and confirm

whatIsMarsha.question: What is a MARSHA code?
whatIsMarsha.answer:
MARSHA is a unique 5-character hotel code in the Marriott system.

Example: NYCVZ — Marriott New York.

This code is used for:
• Hotel identification in the system
• PMS (Property Management System) integration
• Linking Telegram notifications to the hotel

MARSHA codes are managed only by super administrators.

manageMarshaCode.question: How do I manage MARSHA codes?
manageMarshaCode.answer:
1. Open "Settings" → "MARSHA Codes"
2. Find the code by country, region, or brand
3. Assign a code to a hotel or release it

The database contains codes for all Marriott hotels. When creating a new hotel in the system, assign the corresponding MARSHA code.

manageHotels.question: How do I manage multiple hotels?
manageHotels.answer:
As a super administrator you can:

1. Switch between hotels using the selector in the header
2. View any hotel's data
3. Manage users across all hotels in "Accounts"
4. Assign MARSHA codes to new hotels
5. View overall statistics across the entire network
